item.title: 谷歌母公司Alphabet在人工智能支出方面将远超投资者预期
item.description: 字母表公司公布的第四季度营收超出预期，并表示2026年的支出计划远超投资者预期。【原文：Alphabet Inc. reported fourth-quarter revenue that beat expectations and said it planned to spend far more than investors expected in 2026.】

item.title: 高通发布谨慎预测，显示手机市场动荡不安
item.description: 全球最大的智能手机处理器制造商高通公司对当前财季给出了疲软的营收预期，引发市场担忧零部件短缺将推高价格，进而抑制消费者需求。该公司股价在盘后交易中下跌。【原文：Qualcomm Inc., the largest maker of smartphone processors, gave a lackluster revenue forecast for the current period, stoking concern that component shortages will hurt consumer demand by driving prices up. The shares dropped in extended trading.】

item.title: Arm业绩预测令日益持怀疑态度的投资者失望
item.description: Arm控股公司作为计算处理器领域最广泛应用的技术提供商，其公布的季度销售预测虽超出多数预期，却仍未能满足投资者的最高期望。【原文：Arm Holdings Plc, which provides the most widely used technology in computing processors, delivered a quarterly sales forecast that exceeded most estimates but still failed to meet the loftiest hopes of investors.】

item.title: 日本铁娘子如何学会大胆消费并挑战中国
item.description:
选民似乎准备支持首相高市早苗提出的更具进取精神的日本愿景。市场对此持谨慎态度。

【原文：

Voters look set to back Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s vision of a more assertive Japan. Markets are wary.

】

item.title: 纽约市、新泽西州商业团体敦促特朗普恢复关口项目资金
item.description: 商界领袖、劳工团体和交通倡导者正呼吁特朗普政府恢复对连接新泽西州与曼哈顿的160亿美元铁路隧道项目的资金支持。由于缺乏联邦拨款，该项目将于周五停工。【原文：Business leaders, labor groups and transit advocates are calling on the Trump administration to restore funding to a $16 billion rail tunnel that links New Jersey and Manhattan as work on the project is set to shut down on Friday absent federal dollars.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚在工资上涨23%后敦促企业提供定价数据
item.description: 哥伦比亚反垄断机构正敦促企业披露利润率和折扣策略的详细信息，以应对该国近期创纪录的最低工资上调后可能出现的定价操纵问题。【原文：Colombia’s antitrust authority is pressing companies to disclose detailed information on profit margins and discount strategies, to address concern over possible price fixing in the wake of the country’s recent record minimum wage hike.】

item.title: SpaceX合并为马斯克负债累累的人工智能初创企业提供救命稻草
item.description: 从多方面来看，SpaceX是埃隆·马斯克创立的最成功的公司。这家火箭制造商颠覆了航天产业，凭借利润丰厚的政府合同和不断扩大的卫星通信网络，打造出一个市值数十亿美元的企业，至今仍鲜有真正有力的竞争对手。【原文：By many counts, SpaceX is the most successful venture Elon Musk ever started. The rocket maker revolutionized the space industry, built a multibillion-dollar business fueled by lucrative government contracts and a growing satellite communications network, and still has few credible competitors.】

item.title: 石油基金录得2020年以来最大资金流入，伊朗风险持续发酵
item.description: 某石油交易所交易基金创下疫情以来最大单日资金流入，因投资者押注油价将持续上涨——美伊紧张局势持续发酵。【原文：An oil exchange traded fund posted its biggest daily inflow since the pandemic as investors bet that prices will continue to rally as tensions between the US and Iran simmer.】

item.title: 瑞斯塔德咨询公司称，未来数年委内瑞拉石油产量将无法超越该地区其他国家
item.description: 尽管美国正推动对委内瑞拉的投资，但瑞斯塔德能源公司表示，阿根廷、圭亚那和巴西仍将在未来数年主导南美洲的石油产量增长。【原文：Argentina, Guyana and Brazil remain poised to drive oil production growth in South America for years to come despite the US push for investment in Venezuela, Rystad Energy says.】

item.title: 特朗普称若沃什承诺加息 恐难获美联储提名
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德·特朗普表示，如果凯文·沃什曾表达过加息的意愿，他本不会提名沃什担任美联储主席。【原文：US President Donald Trump said he would have passed on Kevin Warsh as his nominee to lead the Federal Reserve if Warsh had expressed a desire to hike interest rates.】

item.title: 与亚马逊云服务数据中心相关的加密债券获得130亿美元订单
item.description: 人工智能的威胁令部分软件公司股价暴跌，市场担忧其业务可能面临颠覆性冲击。【原文：The threat of artificial intelligence has hammered the debt of some software companies on concerns that their businesses could be upended.】

item.title: 怡安集团同意向宾夕法尼亚州教师支付1500万美元和解金
item.description: 怡安集团旗下子公司同意就一起集体诉讼达成和解，该诉讼指控其计算错误和不当投资建议导致宾夕法尼亚州公立学校教师向养老金基金额外缴纳数百万美元。【原文：A unit of Aon Plc agreed to settle a class-action lawsuit alleging that calculation errors and faulty investment advice caused Pennsylvania public school teachers to make millions of dollars in extra contributions to their pension fund.】

item.title: 特朗普的颠覆之年如何反而助益中国
item.description:
从欧洲到亚洲，随着对美国领导力的质疑日益加深，重塑全球贸易与地缘政治格局，"中等强国"正重新调整其对华政策。【原文：

From Europe to Asia, “middle powers” are recalibrating their China policies as growing doubt in US leadership reshapes global trade and geopolitics.

】

item.title: 礼来与诺和诺德因肥胖症前景分歧令华尔街股价剧烈震荡
item.description: 短短19小时内，减肥药制造商诺和诺德和礼来公司对行业前景给出了截然不同的预测。诺和诺德先是警告今年销售额可能下滑多达13%，令市场震惊；随后礼来又意外上调预期，预测销售额将激增27%。【原文：Within the span of 19 hours, weight loss drugmakers Novo Nordisk A/S and Eli Lilly & Co. offered wildly divergent views on where business is headed. After Novo shocked the market by warning sales could decline by as much as 13% this year, Lilly followed with a surprise to the upside, forecasting an as much as 27% rise.】

item.title: 马里布海岸飞地二十年来首度迎来新公寓楼盘
item.description: 加州马里布数十套翻新公寓即将上市，这标志着这个深受名人与超级富豪青睐的反开发飞地二十年来首次出现新公寓库存。【原文：Dozens of refurbished condominiums are hitting the market in Malibu, California, marking the first new condo inventory in two decades in the anti‑development enclave favored by celebrities and the ultra-rich.】

item.title: 脱发治疗公司Veradermics在完成2.56亿美元首次公开募股后股价飙升124%
item.description: 在首次公开募股中筹集2.563亿美元后，生发药物开发商Veradermics公司股票在上市首日涨幅超过一倍。【原文：Shares of hair-restoration drug developer Veradermics Inc. more than doubled in the company’s trading debut after it raised $256.3 million in an initial public offering.】

item.title: 软件空头在股市暴跌中赚取240亿美元利润
item.description: 软件股遭遇惨烈抛售，令华尔街投资者惶惶不安，但这却为做空该板块的投资者提供了良机。【原文：A brutal rout in software stocks has rattled investors across Wall Street, but it’s provided a boon to those betting against the group.】

item.title: 亚马逊前零售主管为初创企业争取Meta成为客户
item.description: 物流软件初创公司Auger已与Meta Platforms公司达成合作协议，该公司由前亚马逊零售业务负责人戴夫·克拉克创立。【原文：Auger, the logistics software startup founded by former Amazon.com Inc. retail chief Dave Clark, has signed up Meta Platforms Inc. as a customer.】

item.title: 苹果股价创一年来最大涨幅，因其避开了人工智能恐慌
item.description: 苹果公司股价走势与科技股及大盘背道而驰，因投资者日益将其视为人工智能颠覆浪潮中的安全港湾。【原文：Apple Inc. is trading in the opposite direction of technology stocks and the broader market as investors increasingly view it as an oasis of safety amid fears of artificial intelligence disruption.】

item.title: 雷森考虑减记债务作为选项之一，因监管机构谈判陷入僵局
item.description: 近日，围绕如何应对雷森公司日益加剧的财务压力的讨论愈演愈烈。随着投资者抛售该公司债券，市场对两大股东科桑公司和壳牌公司能否填补近40亿美元资金缺口的担忧持续升温。【原文：Talks on how to address mounting financial pressures at Raízen SA have intensified in the last few days as investors dump its bonds on growing concern that its two main shareholders, Cosan SA and Shell Plc, won’t cover an almost $4 billion shortfall.】

item.title: 随着制裁放松，Freepoint与Citgo将目光投向委内瑞拉石油
item.description: 随着美国对委内瑞拉的制裁有所放松，自由点商品公司和美国炼油商雪佛龙石油公司正寻求直接获取委内瑞拉石油货运。【原文：Freepoint Commodities and US refiner Citgo Petroleum are seeking direct access to Venezuelan oil cargoes as US sanctions on the South American nation ease.】

item.title: 人工智能初创企业ElevenLabs估值飙升逾三倍，达110亿美元
item.description: 初创公司ElevenLabs利用人工智能技术创造多种逼真人声，其估值在最新融资轮中达到110亿美元，较一年前增长逾三倍。【原文：ElevenLabs, a startup using artificial intelligence to create a wide range of realistic voices, has more than tripled its valuation from a year ago to $11 billion in a fundraising round.】

item.title: SAS正与波音、空客洽谈订单以满足远程航线需求
item.description: SAS航空公司首席执行官表示，该公司正与波音公司和空客公司商谈大规模采购宽体客机事宜。这家北欧航空公司预计，从其哥本哈根枢纽出发的长途旅行需求将持续增长。【原文：SAS AB is in talks with Boeing Co. and Airbus SE about making a large purchase of widebody jets as the Scandinavian carrier bets on increasing demand for long-haul travel from its hub in Copenhagen, the airline’s chief executive officer said.】

item.title: 法国拘留四名涉嫌为中国监视星链的嫌疑人
item.description: 法国当局拘留了四名涉嫌为中国从事技术间谍活动的人员，据称这些活动以埃隆·马斯克的卫星互联网供应商Starlink为目标。【原文：French authorities detained four people accused of spying for China in tech espionage allegedly targeting Elon Musk’s satellite Internet provider Starlink.】

item.title: 微软将用谷歌高管加洛特接替安全主管贝尔
item.description: 微软公司安全主管查理·贝尔将转任专注于工程质量的新个人贡献者职位，其职位将由谷歌云部门的一位高管接替。【原文：Microsoft Corp. security chief Charlie Bell is moving to a new individual contributor role focused on engineering quality and will be replaced by an executive from Google’s cloud unit.】

item.title: 英伟达首席执行官：软件抛售是"世界上最不合逻辑的事情"
item.description: 英伟达公司首席执行官黄仁勋表示，本周软件公司股价因市场担忧人工智能颠覆性影响而遭遇抛售，这种现象毫无道理。该公司设备在全球人工智能数据中心建设中占据核心地位。【原文：Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang, leader of the company’s whose gear is central to the worldwide buildout of artificial intelligence data centers, said this week’s selloff in the shares of software companies amid concerns about AI disruption makes no sense.】

item.title: 据称埃隆·马斯克的SpaceX公司已向非美国银行开放IPO推介
item.description: 知情人士透露，SpaceX已就首次公开募股事宜与美国以外的银行举行会议。这家由埃隆·马斯克创立的火箭与卫星制造商正以雄心勃勃的时间表，计划在今年实现上市。【原文：SpaceX held meetings with banks from outside the US for its IPO, according to people familiar with the matter, as Elon Musk’s rocket and satellite maker targets a listing this year on an ambitious timeline.】

item.title: 共和党关键参议员称鲍威尔作证未触犯法律
item.description: 共和党参议员蒂姆·斯科特表示，美联储主席杰罗姆·鲍威尔去年夏天在国会听证会上回答问题时并未触犯法律。【原文：Republican Senator Tim Scott said Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell didn’t commit a crime when answering questions during a congressional hearing last summer.】

item.title: 新西兰房价跌至30个月低点，买家持观望态度
item.description: 新西兰房价在1月份连续第二个月下跌，创下两年半以来的最低水平，因购房者在对经济复苏更有把握之前仍持观望态度。【原文：New Zealand house prices fell for a second straight month in January, hitting a two-and-a-half year low as buyers stay on the sidelines until they are more assured about the economic recovery.】

item.title: 美国劳工统计局宣布，原定1月的就业报告将推迟至2月11日发布
item.description: 美国劳工统计局表示，原定于1月份发布的就业报告已重新安排至2月11日发布。【原文：The January employment report has been rescheduled for Feb. 11, according to the Bureau of Labor Statistics.】
